Package com.github.ermay12.regex

Class Regex

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ermay12.regex.RegexLiteral
      • com.github.ermay12.regex.Regex
  • public class Regex
extends RegexLiteral
    This class represents a compiled Regular expression. Instances of this class are immutable and safe to be used by multiple concurrent threads.

    Summary of Regular Expression Constructs

    g
    Regular Expression Constructs
    Construct Matches
     
    Characters
    single('x') The character 'x'. Note that this will escape 'x' if necessary (i.e. if it is a special regex character)
    string("ab.") The string 'ab.'. Note that this will escape any characters if necessary (i.e. if it is a special regex character, such as the '.' in this example)
    fromRawRegex("ab.") The regex 'ab.'. Note that this will NOT escape any characters (i.e. the '.' in this example)
     
    Character Classes
    single(CharacterClass) The same thing that the given character class matches. See CharacterClass
     
    Predefined Character Classes
    CharacterClass.WILDCARD Any character. See CharacterClass.WILDCARD
    CharacterClass.DIGIT Any digit (0-9). See CharacterClass.DIGIT
    CharacterClass.WORD_CHARACTER Any word character (a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _). See CharacterClass.WORD_CHARACTER
    CharacterClass.WHITESPACE Any whitespace character ( ,\t,\n,\x0B,\f\r). See CharacterClass.WHITESPACE
     
    Boundaries
    LINE_START The start of a line. If multi-line mode is off, then this matches the start of input
    LINE_END The end of a line. If multi-line mode is off, then this matches the end of input
     
    Quantifiers
    optional(X) X, either once or not at all
    anyAmount(X) X, zero or more times
    atLeastOne(X) X, one or more times
    repeatExactly(X, amount) X, repeated exactly amount times
    repeatAtLeast(X, min) X, min or more times
    repeatAtMost(X, max) X, repeated at most max times
    repeat(X, min, max) X, repeated at least min and at most max times
    Alternative Evaluation type quantifiers
    optional(X, T) X, either once or not at all, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
    anyAmount(X, T) X, zero or more times, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
    atLeastOne(X, T) X, one or more times, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
    repeatExactly(X, amount, T) X, repeated exactly amount times, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
    repeatAtLeast(X, min, T) X, min or more times, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
    repeatAtMost(X, max, T) X, repeated at most max times, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
    repeat(X, min, max, T) X, repeated at least min and at most max times, using the provided EvaluationMethod T
     
    Logical Operators
    new Regex(X1, X2, ...) X1 followed by X2 followed by ...
    concatenate(X1, X2, ...) X1 followed by X2 followed by ...
    oneOf(X1, X2, ...) either X1 or X2 or ...
     
    Back References
    backReference(i) What the i'th capturing group matched
    backReference(group) What the capturing group passed in matched
     
    Lookaround
    lookahead(X) asserts that the rest of the string matches X, but does not consume any characters
    negativeLookahead(X) asserts that the rest of the string does not match X, but does not consume any characters
    lookbehind(X) asserts that the precending bit of the string matches X, but does not consume any characters
    negativeLookbehind(X) asserts that the precending bit of the string does not match X, but does not consume any characters

      Any boundary to a word character

      Returns a new regex that matches the same thing that the i^th capturing group within a larger regex matched.
      static Regex backReference​(CapturingGroup group)
      Returns a new regex that matches the last thing that the capturing group passed in matched.
      static Regex concatenate​(RegexLiteral... components)
      Constructs a regular expression from the given sub-components.
      static Regex fromRawRegex​(java.lang.CharSequence regex)
      Constructs a regular expression from the given raw regular expression.
      static Regex lookahead​(RegexLiteral r)
      Returns a new regex that matches any string that the given regex matches, without consuming any characters.
      static Regex lookbehind​(RegexLiteral r)
      Returns a new regex that asserts that the preceding part of the string (within a larger regex) matches the provided regex r, without consuming any characters.
      static Regex negativeLookahead​(RegexLiteral r)
      Returns a new regex that matches any string that the given regex does not match, without consuming any characters.
      static Regex negativeLookbehind​(RegexLiteral r)
      Returns a new regex that asserts that the preceding part of the string (within a larger regex) does not match the provided regex r, without consuming any characters.
      static Regex oneOf​(RegexLiteral... rs)
      Returns a regex which matches one of the given regular expressions.
      static Regex oneOf​(java.lang.CharSequence... ss)
      Returns a regex which matches one of the given strings.
      static Regex optional​(RegexLiteral r)
      Returns a regex which matches any string that consists of any string the given regex matches repeated either once or not at all

      Returns a regex which matches any string that consists of any string the given regex matches repeated either once or not at all.

      • string

        public static Regex string​(java.lang.CharSequence s)
        Returns a regex that matches a given CharSequence exactly. The given CharSequence has any special regex characters escaped automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - the CharSequence to match against
        Returns:
        a regex that matches the given CharSequence

      • fromRawRegex

        public static Regex fromRawRegex​(java.lang.CharSequence regex)
        Constructs a regular expression from the given raw regular expression. This Regular expression should conform to the Java Regex language. See Pattern
        Parameters:
        regex - the sub-components of the regular expression
        Returns:
        a new regular expression matching the given regex

      • concatenate

        public static Regex concatenate​(RegexLiteral... components)
        Constructs a regular expression from the given sub-components. The new Regex constructed will be the concatenation of all of the subcomponents.

        In other words, if the subcomponents match "a", "b" and "c", then the new regular expression will match "abc"

        Parameters:
        components - the sub-components of the regular expression
        Returns:
        a new regular expression matching the concatenation of the arguments

      • oneOf

        public static Regex oneOf​(java.lang.CharSequence... ss)
        Returns a regex which matches one of the given strings. If no strings are provided in the arguments, a regular expression matching nothing is returned
        Parameters:
        ss - the CharSequences that are the options
        Returns:
        a regex which matches one of the given regular expressions

      • oneOf

        public static Regex oneOf​(RegexLiteral... rs)
        Returns a regex which matches one of the given regular expressions. If no regular expressions are provided in the arguments, a regular expression matching nothing is returned
        Parameters:
        rs - the regular expressions that are the options
        Returns:
        a regex which matches one of the given regular expressions

      • backReference

        public static Regex backReference​(int i)
        Returns a new regex that matches the same thing that the i^th capturing group within a larger regex matched.

        See Capturing Groups in the class-level documentation

        Parameters:
        i - Which capturing group to match on
        Returns:
        a regex that matches the same thing that the i^th capturing group within a larger regex matched.

      • backReference

        public static Regex backReference​(CapturingGroup group)
        Returns a new regex that matches the last thing that the capturing group passed in matched.
        Parameters:
        group - Which capturing group to match on
        Returns:
        a regex that matches the same thing that the last instance of group matched.

      • lookahead

        public static Regex lookahead​(RegexLiteral r)
        Returns a new regex that matches any string that the given regex matches, without consuming any characters. The returned regex essentially acts as an "assert" that the rest of the string matches.

        In technical terms, the new regex performs zero-width positive lookahead on the provided regex

        Parameters:
        r - the regex to perform lookahead on
        Returns:
        a new regex that asserts that the rest of the string matches r, but does not consume any characters

      • negativeLookahead

        public static Regex negativeLookahead​(RegexLiteral r)
        Returns a new regex that matches any string that the given regex does not match, without consuming any characters. The returned regex essentially acts as an "assert" that the rest of the string does not match.

        In technical terms, the new regex performs zero-width negative lookahead on the provided regex

        Parameters:
        r - the regex to perform negative lookahead on
        Returns:
        a new regex that asserts that the rest of the string does not match r, but does not consume any characters

      • lookbehind

        public static Regex lookbehind​(RegexLiteral r)
        Returns a new regex that asserts that the preceding part of the string (within a larger regex) matches the provided regex r, without consuming any characters. The returned regex essentially acts as an "assert" that the previous part of the string matches.

        In technical terms, the new regex performs zero-width positive lookbehind on the provided regex

        Parameters:
        r - the regex to perform lookbehind on
        Returns:
        a new regex that asserts that the preceding part of the string matches r, but does not consume any characters

      • negativeLookbehind

        public static Regex negativeLookbehind​(RegexLiteral r)
        Returns a new regex that asserts that the preceding part of the string (within a larger regex) does not match the provided regex r, without consuming any characters. The returned regex essentially acts as an "assert" that the previous part of the string does not match.

        In technical terms, the new regex performs zero-width negative lookbehind on the provided regex

        Parameters:
        r - the regex to perform negative lookbehind on
        Returns:
        a new regex that asserts that the preceding part of the string does not match r, but does not consume any characters
